file_insights.changes_made: Added import statement for inspection_template module schemas
file_insights.purpose: Export new schemas for EquipmentTemplate, EquipmentApprovalRequest, and InspectionConsultantType models

patterns_discovered.description: The __init__.py file follows a consistent pattern of importing and re-exporting all schemas from submodules, providing a single entry point for importing schemas across the application
Schemas are organized by feature/domain (approval, area, file, audit, inspection_template) with each domain having its own module file
Schemas follow a consistent naming pattern: EntityCreate, EntityUpdate, EntityResponse for CRUD operations

gotchas_discovered.description: The new import statement is lengthy with 7 different schemas exported from a single module, which could reduce readability

approach_outcome.description: Successfully updated the __init__.py file to export all new schemas from the inspection_template module

recommendations.rationale: If the inspection_template module continues to grow with more schemas, consider breaking the import line across multiple lines for better readability

recommendations.recommendation: Ensure inspection_template module exports are correctly defined
recommendations.rationale: Verify that all 7 imported classes (EquipmentTemplateCreate, EquipmentTemplateUpdate, EquipmentTemplateResponse, EquipmentApprovalRequestCreate, EquipmentApprovalRequestUpdate, EquipmentApprovalRequestResponse, InspectionConsultantTypeResponse) are properly defined in the inspection_template.py module
Continue following the alphabetical ordering pattern by domain observed in existing imports for consistency
